attributes.action: Lift EU/US sanctions on Russia to increase trade now the UK is leaving the EU
attributes.background: As the UK has chosen to exit the EU, we will be no longer bound by US-influenced, EU sanctions on Russia. We should lift sanctions on Russia as an independent country to regain the millions of pounds of trade we have lost with Russia. We don't need to participate in EU/US sanctions against Russia.
attributes.additional_details: The EU and the US introduced sanctions on Russia over the democratic decision of the people of Crimea to reunify with Russia and Russia's alleged backing of separatists in Eastern Ukraine. The UK had to participate in this as an EU member. Now the UK is leaving the EU, we need not be dictated to by it. Lost trade with Russia costs the UK many millions of pounds. This is trade that we are now at liberty to get back. Russia is a market of 140m consumers British business needs.

attributes.action: Give all UK citizens living in the EU a vote concerning UK membership of it.
attributes.background: We, the long-term British residents of EU countries, will shortly lose our status as EU citizens, seriously compromising our continued stay in our host countries.  We have had no say in the referendum process, having lost the right to vote. We ask as UK citizens to add our votes to the referendum.

attributes.action: UK must reaffirm its commitment of sovereignty over Gibraltar after Brexit
attributes.background: With Spain renewing its claim of sovereignty over Gibraltar in a matter hours after the UK voted to leave the European Union, the UK Government must immediately reaffirm its commitment to Gibraltar .
attributes.additional_details:
The UK must a make a binding treaty with the European Union guaranteeing Gibraltar special status, which guarantees visa free cross-border movement for people and trade between Gibraltar and Spain. 

The UK government must grant Gibraltar their own dedicated MP in parliament 

The UK must re-establish our permanent Army and Royal Navy bases on Gibraltar to guarantee its future security.

attributes.action: Create the Dog Licence Act 2016
attributes.background:
We British public love our dogs so creating a Dog Licence Act 2016 would create a system which would support policing of dog owners and create a welfare fund for shelters.

To make a legal requirment for all dog owners to have Insurance, Microchipping, Vet Registration and a Dog Licence.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK Population of Dogs is 8.5m fact from RSPCA 2015.

If we charge a fee of £10 per month per Dog Licence of any breed or £120 per year, this would create just over 1 Billion pounds of which the money should be split between the Police for enforcing also administrating and the Animal Shelters to look after dogs in need.

To own a dog the licence criteria must be meet, the dog must be insured, microchipped and registered with a vet, the licence will hold all this information.

attributes.action: Provide Funding To Re-generate & re-open the Sankey Canal and its Locks
attributes.background: The sankey canal has long fell into disrepair, I put it to Rt Hon David Cameron PM & the government to provide additional funding to canals & river trust and st helens local authority to regenerate the first modern canal in england and also of the industrial age.
attributes.additional_details: The Sankey Canal was originally known as the Sankey Brook Navigation and later as the St Helens Canal. It lays claim to being the first modern canal in England, or the first canal of the industrial age, and indeed it opened before its more famous neighbour, the Bridgewater Canal.

attributes.action: Regulate Service Charges for flats/houses leaseholders and freeholders
attributes.background:
House Association can't produce real motivations and explain the increase of Service Charge they managing.
H.A.'s decide unilaterally without involving resident in any decision. For this reason the amount of S.C. asked is not justified and unfair against the tenants which we are not rich.
attributes.additional_details:
1) Resident don't get involved in any decisions. 
2) Enormous increase (double) in less than 5 years? How is it possible? Nothing increased that much services/salaries. 
3) Lack of transparency
4) The property has a number of anomalies some of these are dangerous or create logistical inconvenience to residents
5) competent action against the cooperative to verify why those houses built with public money, a year after its construction they appear with serious defects.

attributes.action: Insert gay rights as part of the school curriculum.
attributes.background: We need a policy that develops a curriculum for children and young people that supports the democratic values of a diverse Britain – including LGBT equality. There are lesbians, gays, bi and trans people in all of our school communities as teachers, support staff, students, parents and governors.
attributes.additional_details: 'Gay' remains the most frequently used term of abuse in UK schools.

attributes.action: The UK should remove the moderator (silencer) licensing requirement for firearms
attributes.background: Moderators (silencers/suppressors) are designed to reduce the volume of a gunshot. Modern shooters & those around them deserve the best in hearing protection, and moderators can help provide this. They should be treated as a safety measure, without the need for expensive FAC variation.
attributes.additional_details:
In many countries throughout the world, moderators are treated as devices to protect the hearing of shooters and those around them.

Removing the requirement for a moderator to be held on a Firearms Certificate would help shooters to further protect their hearing, and would reduce the effect the sound of shooting has on other people & the environment. Furthermore, it would also help reduce police workload as police would no longer have to process certificate variations for moderators.

attributes.action: David Cameron to honour his promise that Shipbuilding would remain in Portsmouth
attributes.background:
THE government is accused of abandoning Portsmouth after ministers failed to answer what action it would take to bring back shipbuilding to the city.

Yesterday saw the collapse of a crucial deal between the Ministry of Defence (MoD) and Magma Structures that would have restored Shipbuilding.
attributes.additional_details:
Likewise, the minister for Portsmouth, Mark Francois, failed to answer the questions sent to him yesterday, instead hailing the move to convert the shiphall into an engineering centre of excellence as ‘exciting’.

Now one of the nation’s biggest trade unions has urged the Tory chief to listen to the city and lay out his plans for the future.

Gary Cook, GMB regional organiser said: ‘It’s absolutely appalling. He (David Cameron) should be ashamed of himself.

attributes.action: Reverse changes to Spousal Visa requirements made in 2012
attributes.background: Prior to 2012 pension funds etc were taken into account to prove financial viability for non-eu spouses to travel to the UK with their returning British Citizen spouses. Also re-instate the ability of High Commissions to approve applications on individual merit, also removed in 2012.
attributes.additional_details: One may have the required GBP62,500+ in a pension fund, but unless the funds are in a current account for 6 months they do not count. This is unfair and prejudicial as to access those funds one has to resign and be jobless whilst waiting for the 6 month period. To force the British spouse to return alone to the UK to satisfy other requirements, for a period of up to 1 year is surely against the Human Right to a Family Life especially if ones child or children are already living there.

attributes.action: More funding for services providing help and support for victims of rape.
attributes.background: I believe there is not enough funding for both the victims of abuse and the police, after the 'Jimmy Savile' effect the police have been swamped with allegations and victims end up feeling neglected and alone.

attributes.action: Freeze funding for students fallen ill until recovered enough to return.
attributes.background: It is completely unfair on those students who fall ill to have to pay for their education should they want to return to study in recovery. This applies to many illnesses but especially mental illness. This petition asks for the funding to be frozen (for up to two years) until they're able to return.

attributes.action: Negotiate and hold a new referendum on moving from EU membership into the EEA.
attributes.background: The recent EU referendum has divided the country and caused chaos. To restore stability we propose that HM Government begins immediate and rapid negotiations on the terms of the UK’s possible transition to the EEA, and then holds a second referendum offering three choices: EEA, EU or neither.
attributes.additional_details:
The EEA is the European Economic Area. It includes the EU countries and Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein. It allows them to be part of the EU’s single market.
Young people, who voted overwhelmingly to stay in the EU, need hope. 16 and 17-year-olds should have the right to vote in the second referendum.
Ireland created strong and democratic precedent for a second EU referendum. Their 2008 referendum rejected the Lisbon Treaty. The government then renegotiated, and a second referendum passed it.

attributes.action: The UK should rejoin the European Free Trade Association as soon as possible.
attributes.background: It is in the best interest of the UK to continue to have free trade with Europe, and it is important for our economy to have a smooth transition when leaving the EU. Rejoining EFTA would allow this. It would help to reunite Leave and Remain supporters and reduce the risk of a breakup of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
Information on the European Free Trade Association:
http://www.efta.int/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/European_Free_Trade_Association

Some opinions on this:

http://www.brugesgroup.com/alternatives-to-the-eu/42-issues/alternatives-to-the-eu/61-71-said-they-would-prefer-britain-to-leave-the-eu-and-join-efta

http://www.iea.org.uk/in-the-media/press-release/iea-presents-four-possible-paths-for-britain-outside-the-eu

http://www.adamsmith.org/evolution-not-revolution/

attributes.action: Create a law preventing the independence of any part of the United Kingdom
attributes.background: After Britain has voted to Leave the European Union, we are faced with the possible break of the UK's union. We must stop this. The UK can stand on its two feet, but cannot if it is split. London, Northern Ireland and Scotland may possibly leave the UK. Let's stop this by signing this petition.

attributes.action: Protect our marine and terrestrial environment after brexit
attributes.background: The UK was bound under EU law to protect the marine and terrestrial environment, this could be threatened due to the referendum. The Water Framework Directive, Habitat Directive, Marine Litter Directive and Bird Directive, all protected these environments. It is important we still follow these.
attributes.additional_details:
These Directives actively reduce pollution, monitor it and help reduce. At the same time it protects wildlife, it would be a backward step for the UK not to monitor and actively take part in these directives. The environment is something we should all treasure and it does not respect boundaries as we do. We must work with the EU to make this work even though we have voted out. 
It is important that fishing quotas remain to protect the future of our fish and seas, or soon there will be no fish.

attributes.action: All multiple occupancy premises must have a fully operational defibrillator.
attributes.background:
Out of hospital cardiac arrests kill more people annually than fire does. 
Make it a legal requirement for all government and commercial multiple occupancy premises, having either a fixed or transitory population, to keep and maintain a fully operational defibrillator.
attributes.additional_details: Fire Extinguishers are compulsory in many buildings; 2013-14 there were 322 fire-related deaths in the UK(Source: UK Gov) but it is estimated that there are about 60k out of hospital cardiac arrests in the UK annually. 30k are discovered in time to help save the victim’s life(Source: BHF). If response time for using defibrillators was shortened to within 8 minutes it would save the lives of 15 out of 100 people who collapse with cardiac arrest.(Source: Milan, Brescia and Washington Universities)

attributes.action: Keep spending a fixed 0.7 per cent slice of our national wealth on Foreign Aid
attributes.background: A popular petition wants to end our committment: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/125692 . This is totally wrong. As a country, we committed to giving 0.7% of our GDP to help countries which are in far direr straits than we are. Charity starts at home, but we must help others too.
attributes.additional_details:
People often protest that it all goes to corrupt officials, but the solution is not to spend less, but to spend smarter. We must keep giving for those who do use the money wisely.

A way to improve the effectiveness of foreign aid could be to end the requirement for countries to subscribe to free trade deals when they receive certain forms of it (as economist Ha-Joon Chang argues).

This webpage counters many myths about foreign aid: https://www.givingwhatwecan.org/get-involved/myths-about-aid/

attributes.action: No more Government aid abroad, use money to find cure for cancer.
attributes.background: The year is only 3 months old, and too many people's lives have been lost due to this awful disease. It is about time that instead of billions of pounds being sent in aid abroad, a massive boost is given by the Government into finding an immediate cure for Cancer.
attributes.additional_details: This week alone, several famous names have passed away from Cancer.

attributes.action: Stop Animal Testing!
attributes.background:
No animal should be harmed, hurt or killed for cosmetics. We want the government to introduce a law which will ban testing on animals.

For More information visit:
http://talk-about-testing.blogspot.co.uk/
attributes.additional_details:
For more information visit:
http://talk-about-testing.blogspot.co.uk/

http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-experiment-on/
http://www.peta.org.uk/issues/animals-not-experiment-on/alternatives-animal-testing/

attributes.action: Call to clampdown on tax avoidance & evasion, continue overseas aid of 0.7% GDP
attributes.background:
1.	Make a substantial effort to clampdown on tax avoidance, to tax companies based on profits made in the UK, rather than their location. 
2.	Call on the government to support the European Council’s Common Consolidated Corporate Tax Base proposals. 
3.	Continue overseas aid budget 0.7% of GDP

attributes.action: Get rid of the extra 3 per cent stamp duty bill
attributes.background: From April 1 2016, anyone purchasing an additional property will have to pay an extra 3 per cent stamp duty.  The changes apply to companies and individuals no matter how many properties you are purchasing.
attributes.additional_details: Anyone owning a second property that isn't their main residence and buying another, or replacing the one they don't live in, is likely to get caught up in the changes. So even if you are applying for a joint mortgage to enable someone to get on the property ladder as a first time buyer you have to pay the stamp duty making it impossible for first time buyers.

attributes.action: Pass legislation enabling families to take in unaccompanied refugee children.
attributes.background:
Families were encouraged to rescue children during WW2 via the kinder transport program.

Unfortunately we live in a different era, and legisition as it exists would not allow this to happen even if it was a formal program.
attributes.additional_details: The Kindertransport was an organised rescue effort that took place during the nine months prior to the outbreak of the Second World War. The United Kingdom took in nearly 10,000 predominantly Jewish children from Germany, Austria, Czechoslovakia, Poland, and the Free City of Danzig. The children were placed in British foster homes, hostels, schools and farms. Often they were the only members of their families who survived the Holocaust.

attributes.action: Raise British solider starting salary by 20% (£21,600).
attributes.background: Soldiers risk their lives for there country and people they don't know all for very little pay, especially after taxes have been deducted. They do not get choose of whether to go to war and when they go to war, during Christmas and other holidays.
attributes.additional_details: soldiers get a starting salary £18,000 a year before taxes and £15,327.20 after just taxes (correct on 02/03/2016)

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement that all animals knocked over by cars are reported.
attributes.background: Dogs and wild animals under the law must be reported to the police; however animals, such as cats are are knocked over fairly regularly and the person who does it does not do anything about it and just carry on driving.
attributes.additional_details:
In the past couple of months 3 cats have been hit by cars and the driver has just carried in driving, almost as if it is an intentional act; not only this two of my cats have been killed by an act like this and I was not notified by the person who did it, a friend of mine told me that my cat wasn't breathing by the side of the road. 
If a dogs, swans and deer must be reported by law, so why does this mean that other animals are disregarded?

attributes.action: Introduce a Fixed Penalty Notice and Fine - Excessive Alcohol Consumption in A&E
attributes.background:
Introduce a fixed penalty notice and fine (~£50) for admittances to A&E due to excessive alcohol consumption. Plus an additional charge for unnecessary ambulance call-outs.
This should, in theory, encourage people to consume within their limits and deter from binge drinking and drinking to excess.
attributes.additional_details:
Alcohol-related admissions put A&E departments under severe pressure. Action needs to be taken to reduce both the physical and financial strain on the NHS.

'Up to 35% of A&E visits are down to alcohol' (Balance Alcohol Office, 2015)

'Often they don’t need A&E help – they just need to sleep it off. But then they’re drunk and don't know what they need so they just call [for a paramedic].' (Royal Liverpool Hospital, 2015)

'The NHS incurs £6.5bn a year in costs related to alcohol.' (NHS, 2014)

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on using Single Transferable Vote in Parliamentary Elections
attributes.background:
After the last General Election we awoke to a Parliament which nearly 2/3 of the country had voted against. Now, in an age of smaller and more specialised political parties, voters are punished for backing their actual favourite candidates and parties.
We want representation, we need reformation.
attributes.additional_details:
Single Transferable Vote (STV) is a type of Proportional Representation which still allows for local candidates and representatives through use of ranges.

For more info on the imbalance between votes and seats in our current Parliament watch goo.gl/bZwsxJ

For more info on STV and why this can lead to better representation watch goo.gl/wB7ybJ

For more info on STV and it's Pros and Cons from the Electoral Reform Society visit goo.gl/urkDXf

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on London becoming independent from the UK
attributes.background:
London is the world's capital. 300+ languages are spoken here. Immigrants are welcome, and are vital to our economy.

We voted decisively to stay in the EU. Our global outlook sets us apart from the rest of England.

London's population is 8.5m – Scotland's is 5.3m.

Independence makes sense.
attributes.additional_details: Specifics: If you live within the M25, you get a vote – just like in the Scottish referendum. It doesn't matter if you're a British citizen or not. If you don't live within the M25, you don't get a vote.

attributes.action: Replace subsidies for green energy (FITs)  with a loan guarantee scheme.
attributes.background:
Producing green energy has become more viable as cost of deployment has reduced drastically (IRENA).
Loan guarantees would enable more schemes to be built than subsidies (FITs) and could potentially negate the need for the nuclear plant at Hinkley whilst contributing towards environmental targets.
attributes.additional_details:
Government subsidies (FITs) for medium/large scale green energy schemes have been reduced.  
New schemes face difficulty in raising finance because lenders are unable to analyse the risk/reward the sector represents.  
Finance contributes to the 25 Giga Watts held up and awaiting deployment (DECC April 2016).  
A rolling scheme of up to £5 billion could replace the need for Hinkley Point C to be built providing 3200+ MW of green energy.
Example:  www.greensaturn.com/content/pages/renewablesnothinkley

attributes.action: Different exams for private and state educated pupils
attributes.background: Privately educated children should sit different GCSE and A Level exams to children from state schools. This is because the quality of education for children who's parents are paying over £15k a year will undoubtedly be very different to a student attending the local state school.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing this to happen, the government is not doing enough to close the gap between the rich and the poor. Every year, 5 top independent schools send over 2000 pupils to Oxbridge between them. These kids have almost definitely performed well on the same exams as your sons and daughters whilst driving up the grade boundaries and making it harder to achieve top grades to apply to top universities. How can a child who did not pay for their education be expected to compete with children who did?

attributes.action: Strict penalties for internet providers who fail to prevent repeat IP theft.
attributes.background:
Laws exist to protect Intellectual Property but means to enforce it can be financially unviable. Justice for all, irrelevant of budget. 

Greater penalties to service providers (SPs) failing to prevent repeat infringements & ban SPs from retaining IP unless solely to prevent repeat infringements.
attributes.additional_details:
Safe harbour is abused by SPs allowing repeat infringements and not banning all reported infringers. Sanctions to be made. Enact true Take Down - Stay Down! Technology exists to enact it but is not being utilised.

IPO & PIPCU to conduct an investigation into persistent offender Amazon, it's practices & take-down process.

Protect consumers from inferior & potentially dangerous products.

Make available funding for media campaigns to raise awareness of costs to IP owners and consumers.

attributes.action: End the compulsory licence fee for those who do not use BBC services.
attributes.background: BBC channels are always included in media packages for television viewing whether paid versions or freeview versions. This then results in the compulsory purchase of a TV licence as the 'choice' to not use these services is removed.
attributes.additional_details: This is a petition is to end compulsory inclusion of BBC services in media packages and to therefore remove or vastly reduce the licence fee for those who do not choose to use the BBC services. We should not have to pay for services not required just because we have media viewing devices in our homes.

attributes.action: Charge 20p per prescription item for those who are normally exempt to stop waste
attributes.background: 20p per prescription item will encourage people to check their medication stock before reordering everything. 20p charge will also prevent pharmacies from fraudulently ordering everything for their patients. Multi millions could be saved and used for treatment we currently can not afford.
attributes.additional_details: SAVE our NHS. 20p per item will not be unaffordable for the vast majority. MILLIONS of pounds will be saved!

attributes.action: Cap Rent in the Private Sector
attributes.background: Each year rent increases by a substantial amount in the Private Rental sector, and people cannot cope with the fast growth on rental inflammation, as their salary does not always increase to maintain affordable housing.
attributes.additional_details: The Government needs to apply rent caps as to what landlords can charge to tenants in their properties; if people can save while they rent they may be able to start saving to put a realistic deposit down on a realistic priced house.

attributes.action: A legal requirement for ministers to have worked in the industry they represent
attributes.background: This country needs ministers who have worked in their industries as we have a health secretary who has never worked in the NHS or any medical environment, an education secretary who has never worked in a school or OFSTED...
attributes.additional_details:
We also have a chancellor of the exchequer who has never worked in finance, a justice secretary and former education secretary who has never worked in a courthouse nor a school, and this list goes on

We need ministers who have a deep understanding of the industries they represent, they have their own profession in their interests

So we are calling for a legal requirement of ministers to have worked in their respective industries for at least 5 - 10 years prior to appointment as their minister

attributes.action: Ban the sale of all energy drinks to under 18's
attributes.background: My14 year old son came home with an energy drink today and it has sent him absolutely manic. Today I saw the high physical/ psychological effects. Children cannot make informed decisions about these drinks.
attributes.additional_details:
>I feel these drinks should not be sold to under 18's.
>Energy drinks could cause public health problems(WHO)
>(eg Red Bull and Monster) contain high levels of caffeine
> increasingly popular, especially with young people.
>health risks related-energy drinks. 
>concerns raised both by scientific community and general public about the health effects of these drinks.
>researchers: potential health risks associated with the high caffeine content
>long-term research/policy action needed (NHS, 2016)

attributes.action: Reverse the decision to make GCSE and A levels 100% exam based.
attributes.background:
The government has reintroduced the antiquated and flawed 100% exam based GCSE and A levels.
Teachers don't want it, students don't want it and employers do not want it. Yet the policy has been bullied through with no democratic process.

attributes.action: To protect the districts of Kirklees, Calderdale from river flooding
attributes.background: To instigate and drive the authorities of Kirklees, Calderdale to produce and deliver a robust plan to mitigate the flooding problem across our districts.By encouraging farmland to flood where there is no danger to property or life up steam of our towns would mitigate the problem.
attributes.additional_details: To add a fourth category, flood plain earmarked for no Development.

attributes.action: Raise child refugee safeguarding needs with European partner states
attributes.background: Euro-pol believe that over 10,000 child refugees have gone missing since being registered on arrival in European Union countries. This suggests a complete absence of safeguarding of refugee children and therefore an unacceptable failure on the part of European states.
attributes.additional_details: Euro-pol news item on 31/1/2016. Over 10,000 registered refugee children missing.

attributes.action: Women and Equalitiy Committee to conduct a full review of the TransInquiry
attributes.background: The Women and Equalities Commision published the Transgender Equality Report on the 7th July 2016. It does not address any of the main concerned of Transgended Men and Women in the UK. It pastes over cracks in the systems, law and the rights of Trans people. Our community demands a full review.
attributes.additional_details: There are 35 recommendations writhin the report and the majority are incomplete. The Transgender community requires that a further review is taken to ensure that the Women and Equalities Commision continue the work that have done to fully address all 35 recommendations and too ensure all are fully addressed in the shortest possible timeframe. This report must be treated as an interim report that is a work in progress. We demand the right to appropriate treatment and complete self determination.

attributes.action: Legislation to curb newspapers from knowingly printing factual inaccuracies.
attributes.background: Given the major complaint during the EU referendum was one of factual inaccuracies there should be a way to hold newspapers to account without limiting freedom of the press. If a lie is told on the front page the apology/correction should also be on the front page thus making them more accountable.
attributes.additional_details:
The press in the UK is currently beyond reproach. It can print a headline that is totally untrue and currently only be forced to print a small correction where most will not see it. 
Recognising the freedom of the press is sacrosanct we must act to ensure they are accountable in a way that does not impinge upon this. Forcing them to give equal space to which the falsehood was printed under regulation by an independent body would help deter them from knowingly printing lies for political gain.

attributes.action: Stop the sale and import of dyed fish in the UK. It is cruel and unnecessary
attributes.background: Stop the sale and import of dyed fish. Fish are beautiful in their own right. Injecting them with dye is cruel and unnecessary. It is illegal to dye them yourself in the UK but not to import them. The fish suffer and it shortens their life span.

attributes.action: ALL coffee, tea , cocoa, chocolate sold in UK to be Fair Trade certified.
attributes.background: Free of EU Trade Restrictions - this petition calls for legislation to end Slavery in the tea, coffee and cocoa farming industries. It calls upon the Government to pass a law requiring ALL tea and coffee and cocoa (chocolate) sold in the UK to be Fair Trade (or Rainforest Alliance) Certified.
attributes.additional_details:
Ask yourself: Is it right that tea that is sold in the UK may be picked by people in bonded labour who have to live amongst their own sewage? Is it fair that the chocolate you buy as an after-school treat for your children contains cocoa picked by a farmer who can’t afford to send her own children to school?

I have dreamt for many years that Britain would one day act to end modern Slavery. Such a law will demonstrate that the UK is outward looking and compassionate, and truly define a new era!

attributes.action: Call a general election in the next 90 days as a result of the EU vote.
attributes.background: This vote should never have been called and as a result the population of the United Kingdom has no confidence in the leadership of the government. We demand a general election in the next 90 days to elect new leaders to help manage this emerging crisis.

attributes.action: Stop housing associations putting registered sex offenders in their properties.
attributes.background: Recently quite a number of registered sex offenders have been allowed to reside in properties owned by a housing association. Two within yards of each other. The area the properties are in is heavily populated by children, also up the road from a school.
attributes.additional_details: One of the offenders moved a few months ago, and since reoffended and been given a custodial sentence. The other is still in residence. There was another offender who owned his property, who reoffended and has since left the area. These are the registered sex offenders we are aware of, no doubt there will be more. Our concern is allowing registered sex offenders to live in an area like this, is a recipe for disaster. We have our children to think about.

attributes.action: Stop permission to build Branston Road School Academy on current proposed site
attributes.background: Vital arable land will be lost. Hedgerow vital to wildlife will be destroyed. Applicant, Planning Authority & Education Authority are one and the same! Surrounding villages were promised green barrier and then this was permitted! Villages not designed to cope with current traffic without school.
attributes.additional_details: Tatenhill Parish Councillors can be contacted for further info.  Burton Mail also has articles referencing objections.

attributes.action: Change the law on eligibility to stand for elected local government posts
attributes.background: Make it unlawful to hold 2 elected posts within local government simultaneously. Make it unlawful for 2 members of the same household (eg spouses) to hold simultaneous posts within the same County council or District within that county.
attributes.additional_details: Recent elections for Police and Crime Commissioner in Warwickshire resulted in the candidate elected being the spouse of the Leader of Warwickshire County Council. The leader of Stratford upon Avon District council also holds a position on Warwickshire County Council. Other councillors hold positions on both District and County Councils. It is hard to envisage how these dual roles and close relationships can not lead to undemocratic influences, whether knowingly or unwittingly.

attributes.action: Fund university expenditure for the production of radiolabelled Vitamin B12
attributes.background:
People with Vitamin B12 deficiency caused by Pernicious Anaemia have problems with diagnosis because the available tests are inaccurate.

The Schilling Test can accurately diagnose the cause of Vitamin B12 but is no longer performed because nobody makes the radiolabeled cobalt required.
attributes.additional_details:
Vitamin B12 blood tests are inaccurate. The test for the antibodies responsible for PA is only accurate 50% of the time.

The Schilling Test requires radiolabelled cobalt. A government-sponsored source could make it possible to reinstate this test.



Reference for inaccuracy of tests - 
http://www.bcshguidelines.com/documents/BCSH_Cobalamin_and_Folate_Guidelines_(2).docx.pdf
Reference for Schilling Test - 
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Schilling_test

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to implement a Universal Basic Income scheme in the UK.
attributes.background:
Instead of running an expensive mean tested benefits system; instead pay adult in the UK a Basic living income to end poverty within the UK.

This will reduce the cost of administering the welfare state.

attributes.action: Child Maintenance should not be payable whilst a custody battle is ongoing
attributes.background: Where there is no evidence of domestic violence, child abduction, sexual, drug or alcohol abuse & the resident parent is withholding access from the other parent, Child Maintenance should not be awarded to the resident parent until the courts have ruled otherwise.
attributes.additional_details: Some resident parents use the child as a bargaining chip, robbing the child of a chance to know both parents. The courts can take many months to make a decision. Meanwhile, the non-resident parent pays thousands of pounds to perpetuate the injustice of not seeing the child. Where there is no evidence of abuse or evidence to support risk of abduction, the non-resident parent should not be paying thousands while not allowed contact with the child.
